revised_title: Investigating the Elastic Force of Atmospheric Air and Mercury's Melting Point
tldr: The author conducted experiments to determine the temperature of the melting point of mercury and the change of the elastic force of atmospheric air between 32°F and 212°F. They developed an air thermometer and used it to measure the temperature, finding that the melting point of well-purified mercury is practically a constant temperature, regardless of the specimen or mass. This research contributed to the understanding of thermodynamics and temperature measurement.
